bibl.title: Poets and Pagans in Byzantine Egypt.
bibl.note: "Egypt of late antiquity was essentially a Christian world. Many scholars have argued or assumed that there was a determined pagan resistance in some areas. At one time I was sympathetic to this view myself, but I am now more sceptical."
bibl.seg: CAMERON Alan, Poets and Pagans in Byzantine Egypt.
Roger S. BAGNALL (Ed.), Egypt in the Byzantine World, 300-700 (Cambridge, 2007) pp. 21-46.

"Egypt of late antiquity was essentially a Christian world. Many scholars have argued or assumed that there was a determined pagan resistance in some areas. At one time I was sympathetic to this view myself, but I am now more sceptical."
